wesm commented on issue #3527: ARROW-4431: [C++] Fixes for gRPC vendored builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3527#issuecomment-459127433
 
 
   Hm this macOS failure seems unrelated
   
   ```
   debug/libarrow_testing.13.0.0.dylib debug/libarrow.13.0.0.dylib /Users/travis/build/apache/arrow/cpp-toolchain/lib/libdouble-conversion.a arrow_thirdparty/lib/libboost_system.a arrow_thirdparty/lib/libboost_filesystem.a arrow_thirdparty/lib/libboost_regex.a /Users/travis/build/apache/arrow/cpp-toolchain/lib/libgtest_main.a /Users/travis/build/apache/arrow/cpp-toolchain/lib/libgtest.a arrow_thirdparty/lib/libjemalloc_pic.a && :
   Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
     "boost::system::detail::generic_category_ncx()", referenced from:
         boost::system::generic_category() in hdfs-test.cc.o
   ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
   clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
   ```
   
   I'll fix the rebase conflict later and see if this is transient
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fields.summary: [C++] Build gRPC as ExternalProject without allowing it to build its vendored dependencies
